name: git-commit
description: Git commit with standardized message format
prompt:
Create a Git commit with standardized message format.

STEPS:
1. Check git status:
   git status

2. Show changes:
   git diff

3. Analyze changes and categorize:
   - feat: New feature
   - fix: Bug fix
   - refactor: Code restructuring
   - style: Formatting, CSS changes
   - docs: Documentation only
   - perf: Performance improvement
   - test: Testing
   - chore: Build, config changes

4. Ask user to confirm commit message:
   FORMAT: {type}({scope}): {description}
   
   EXAMPLES:
   feat(inserted): Add quantity calculator with real-time pricing
   fix(namecard): Correct bind_param parameter count in add_to_basket
   refactor(gallery): Unify gallery system across all products
   style(common): Update button styles for consistency
   docs(claude): Update CLAUDE.md with new MCP configuration

5. Add files:
   git add .

6. Commit with message:
   git commit -m "{type}({scope}): {description}
   
   ðŸ¤– Generated with Claude Code
   Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>"

7. Show commit:
   git log -1 --stat

8. Ask if user wants to push:
   git push origin main
